name: reprehend
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to express your strong official disapproval of someone or something: The agency was reprehended for taking on average two years to deal with complaints. There were those who reprehended the practice of wearing one's hair long.
More examplesFewer examplesOf course you must be the one to reprehend him.His behaviour cannot be too strongly reprehended.We may not reprehend what we cannot comprehend.
